snippet: Tikkun Olam, a government-approved farm where new strains of cannabis are being developed, is at the center of the debate in Israel on the legality, benefits and risks of medical marijuana.
abstract: Safed Journal; Tikkun Olam, government-approved farm in Safed, Israel, where new strains of cannabis are being developed, is at center of debate on legality, benefits and risks of medical marijuana; proponents hope research will uncover plant's potential to help the sick and may help brand Israel as something other than conflict zone.
lead_paragraph: Tikkun Olam, a government-approved farm where new strains of cannabis are being developed, is at the center of the debate in Israel on the legality, benefits and risks of medical marijuana.

headline.seo: New Insights on Marijuana in Israel, Where It’s Illegal
headline.main: Studying Marijuana and Its Loftier Purpose
headline.print_headline: Studying Marijuana And Its Loftier Purpose
